title: Suite Of The Week: The Empire Terrace Suite at Andaz 5th Avenue
text:
Sponsored by Jim Beam ® Devil’s Cut ®
*Win a trip to New York and stay in this suite! Click here to enter a photo for a chance to win! Must be 21+ to enter, see rules for details.
NO PURCHASE NECESSARY. See Official Rules for details and eligibility. Starts 12:00:01 a.m. ET 8/18 and ends 11:59:59 p.m. ET 9/24/2015. Open to legal U.S. residents 21 years + Void where prohibited.
Where is it? One of the few Manhattan hotels located directly on Fifth Avenue, the hotel has a unique location right across the street from – and with an unparalleled view of – The New York Public Library, one of the city’s grand landmarks. Andaz 5 th Avenue nods to the icon with its own intimate library nook on the ground level, where a rotating collection of titles is on display.
The Hotel? Andaz 5th Avenue offers attentive, uncomplicated service in a relaxed sophisticated environment designed to accommodate guests’ personal preferences and style. This Tony Chi designed property features 184 well-appointed guest rooms starting at 322 square feet.
The Suite? Empire Terrace Suite. This suite’s 793 – square-foot wrap-around terrace, with expansive views that include the Empire State Building and the New York Public Library, is Manhattan living at its best. The Tony Chi-designed 986-square-foot two-bedroom corner suite has a sitting area with sleeper sofa, kitchenette, and 12-foot ceilings with oversized windows. Steel-blue walls and black poplar shutter doors lend a serene feel to the loft-like space and light fixtures, which evoke subway lanterns, are inspired by the neighborhood. Two oversized travertine marble bathrooms each feature walk-in rain showers, double sinks and relaxing foot baths, and come stocked with exclusive amenities from Beekman 1802. Non-alcoholic mini-bar beverages and welcome snacks, wireless Internet, local phone calls, and access to the gym at our Midtown New York hotel are complimentary. The rooms also feature a Z2-Bowers & Wilkins Sound System with iPod® docking and a 54” flat screen TV in the sitting area, and a 42” HDTV in each bedroom.
By the Numbers: From Rockefeller Plaza, to The Empire State Building and Freedom Tower, the view from this 793 sq ft wrap-around-terrace has inspired poets and painters alike and will easily become your new favorite place on earth.
Inside you will find 986 sq ft comprised of two bedrooms, two spacious travertine marble bathrooms with double sinks, walk-in rain showers and porcelain foot baths. A large seating area with oversized desk and a kitchenette complete the haven you will happily call home while staying in New York City. Views of Times Square include the legendary Swarovski Crystal New Year’s Eve Ball.
The Rate: $2700-$3000/night.
